title: Jose Mourinho wants a job ‘like Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has got where you are protected’
text:
Solskjaer has ‘protection’, according to Mourinho (Picture: Getty)

Jose Mourinho believes Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is protected from criticism about the current state of the Manchester United team because the club are now focused on the future.

Solskjaer’s United are 14th in the Premier League table and could slip to 15th if they drop points against Liverpool and Sheffield United get a result versus Arsenal on Monday evening.

But the Norwegian has received the public backing of executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward this week, the man who sacked Mourinho, and both have given interviews talking up the progress of the young squad Solskjaer has at his disposal.

Mourinho is yet to find a new job since leaving United last December but while working as a Sky Sports pundit, suggested he would have been allowed to stay at the club if he had been given the same sort of treatment as the current incumbent.

Mourinho was speaking during a punditry stint for Sky Sports (Picture: Sky Sports)

‘[United] did some good PR during the week to make the situation clear or to try to create a positive atmosphere for the game,’ Mourinho said.

‘I think they did very very well.

‘What I understood from [the interviews was that the objectives are the future.

‘I am going to try to get a job like Ole has at this moment in the future which is to speak all the time about the future and then you are protected about the present.

‘I think it’s a great situation. He has a three-year contract, [it’s all about] the future and the young players.

‘And just at the end of his message [he said] results are important.

‘I think it’s a great job to do in such a giant club like Manchester United.’

Solskjaer was given a lead role in United’s transfer business this summer as they signed Daniel James, Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Harry Maguire with a clear policy of prioritising youth.

And his boss Woodward also made a point of praising the recruitment done over the summer and the nature of the current group.

‘The changes we saw over the summer have resulted in a very young squad,’ said Woodward.

‘But it’s also a squad, with the players and the culture, that provides a base camp for us to build and grow from as we start our new journey.’
description: Jose Mourinho believes Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is protected from criticism about the current state of the Manchester United team because the club are now focused on the future.
